chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bronshay M. Jamerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/Maintain full time employment and/or education and/or a combination as approved by agent.

Register with Sex Offender Registry Program for Lifetime. Enter into and participate in and successfully complete any assessment, evaluations, and/or treatmetn programs as directed by agent.
No contact with anyone under the age of 18.
Participate in other counseling as recommended by agent.

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment is summarily affirmed.  Wis. STAT. Rule 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that attorney Jefren E.Olsen is relieved of further representing Jamerson in this matter.  See Wis. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
SEALED

Case Called: 1:41 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by DDA Theresa Wetzsteon. Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.
Parties state corrections to be made to the PSI.
K.D. sworn and testifies. Court rules on Corrections to the PSI.
State makes sentencing arguments.
Defense makes sentencing arguments.
Court addresses the Defendant.

COURT ORDERS:
Ct. 1 (2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child)>> 16 Years WSPS, 8 Years IC and 8 Years ES. Court finds 359 days credit. CONDITIONS: Register with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry Program for Lifetime, No Contact with anyone under age of 18, Enter into and participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations, and/or treatment programs as directed by agent, Participate in other counseling as recommended by agent, Pay all court ordered Court Obligations, DNA Sample and Surcharge, Supervision Fees, and any other fees/fines/debts, Obtain/Maintain full-time employment and/or education and/or a combination as approved by agent. 
Defendant is not eligible for programming.

PSI TO BE SEALED.

Adj: 3:15 pm
